name: BD+14 4559
scenarioDescription:
The BD+14 4559 Exoplanetary System


Overview

BD+14 4559 is a star with 0.49 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.86 times its radius. It is located 161.19 light years away from the solar system.

BD+14 4559 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the BD+14 4559 system


BD+14 4559 b

BD+14 4559 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.78 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of BD+14 4559 b is 330.72 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, BD+14 4559 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system BD+14 4559, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by McDonald Observatory.
